verses.verse: O <S%H3068>Lord<s%>, I have <S%H8085>heard<s%> your <S%H8088>speech<s%>, and was <S%H3372>afraid<s%>: O <S%H3068>Lord<s%>, <S%H2421>revive<s%> your <S%H6467>work<s%> in the <S%H7130>midst<s%> of the <S%H8141>years<s%>, in the <S%H7130>midst<s%> of the <S%H8141>years<s%> make <S%H3045>known<s%>; in <S%H7267>wrath<s%> <S%H2142>remember<s%> <S%H7355>mercy<s%>.

<S%H433>God<s%> <S%H935>came<s%> from <S%H8487>Teman<s%>, and the Holy <S%H6918>One<s%> from <S%H2022>mountain<s%> <S%H6290>Paran<s%>. <S%H5542>Selah<s%>. His <S%H1935>glory<s%> <S%H3680>covered<s%> the <S%H8064>heavens<s%>, and the <S%H776>earth<s%> was <S%H4390>full<s%> of his <S%H8416>praise<s%>.
And his <S%H5051>brightness<s%> was as the <S%H216>light<s%>; he had <S%H7161>horns<s%> coming out of his <S%H3027>hand<s%>: and there was the <S%H2253>hiding<s%> of his <S%H5797>power<s%>.
<S%H6440>Before<s%> him <S%H3212>went<s%> the <S%H1698>pestilence<s%>, and burning <S%H7565>coals<s%> went <S%H3318>forth<s%> at his <S%H7272>feet<s%>.

He <S%H5975>stood<s%>, and <S%H4128>measured<s%> the <S%H776>earth<s%>: he <S%H7200>looked<s%>, and drove <S%H5425>asunder<s%> the <S%H1471>nations<s%>; and the <S%H5703>everlasting<s%> <S%H2042>mountains<s%> were <S%H6327>scattered<s%>, the <S%H5769>perpetual<s%> <S%H1389>hills<s%> did <S%H7817>bow<s%>: his <S%H1979>ways<s%> are <S%H5769>everlasting<s%>.
I <S%H7200>saw<s%> the <S%H168>tents<s%> of <S%H3572>Cushan<s%> in <S%H205>affliction<s%>: and the <S%H3407>curtains<s%> of the <S%H776>land<s%> of <S%H4080>Midian<s%> did <S%H7264>tremble<s%>.

Was the <S%H3068>Lord<s%> <S%H2734>displeased<s%> against the <S%H5104>rivers<s%>? was your <S%H639>anger<s%> against the <S%H5104>rivers<s%>? was your <S%H5678>wrath<s%> against the <S%H3220>sea<s%>, that you did <S%H7392>ride<s%> upon your <S%H5483>horses<s%> and your <S%H4818>chariots<s%> of <S%H3444>salvation<s%>?

Your <S%H7198>bow<s%> was made <S%H6181>quite<s%> <S%H5783>naked<s%>, according to the <S%H7621>oaths<s%> of the <S%H4294>tribes<s%>, even your <S%H562>word<s%>. <S%H5542>Selah<s%>. You did <S%H1234>cleave<s%> the <S%H776>earth<s%> with <S%H5104>rivers<s%>.

The <S%H2022>mountains<s%> <S%H7200>saw<s%> <S%H2342>you<s%>, and they trembled: the <S%H2230>overflowing<s%> of the <S%H4325>water<s%> passed <S%H5674>by<s%>: the <S%H8415>deep<s%> <S%H5414>uttered<s%> his <S%H6963>voice<s%>, and lifted <S%H5375>up<s%> his <S%H3027>hands<s%> on <S%H7315>high<s%>.

The <S%H8121>sun<s%> and <S%H3394>moon<s%> stood <S%H5975>still<s%> in their <S%H2073>habitation<s%>: at the <S%H216>light<s%> of your <S%H2671>arrows<s%> they <S%H1980>went<s%>, and at the <S%H5051>shining<s%> of your <S%H1300>glittering<s%> <S%H2595>spear<s%>.
You did march <S%H6805>through<s%> the <S%H776>land<s%> in <S%H2195>indignation<s%>, you did <S%H1758>thresh<s%> the <S%H1471>heathen<s%> in <S%H639>anger<s%>.

You went <S%H3318>forth<s%> for the <S%H3468>salvation<s%> of your <S%H5971>people<s%>, even for <S%H3468>salvation<s%> with your <S%H4899>anointed<s%>; you <S%H4272>wounded<s%> the <S%H7218>head<s%> out of the <S%H1004>house<s%> of the <S%H7563>wicked<s%>, by <S%H6168>discovering<s%> the <S%H3247>foundation<s%> unto the <S%H6677>neck<s%>. <S%H5542>Selah.<s%>

You did strike <S%H5344>through<s%> with his <S%H4294>poles<s%> the <S%H7218>head<s%> of his <S%H6518>villages<s%>: they came out as a <S%H5590>whirlwind<s%> to <S%H6327>scatter<s%> <S%H5951>me<s%>: their rejoicing was as to <S%H398>devour<s%> the <S%H6041>poor<s%> <S%H4565>secretly<s%>.
You did <S%H1869>walk<s%> through the <S%H3220>sea<s%> with your <S%H5483>horses<s%>, through the <S%H2563>heap<s%> of <S%H7227>great<s%> <S%H4325>waters<s%>.

When I <S%H8085>heard<s%>, my <S%H990>belly<s%> <S%H7264>trembled<s%>; my <S%H8193>lips<s%> <S%H6750>quivered<s%> at the <S%H6963>voice<s%>: <S%H7538>rottenness<s%> <S%H935>entered<s%> into my <S%H6106>bones<s%>, and I <S%H7264>trembled<s%> in <S%H5117>myself<s%>, that I might rest in the <S%H3117>day<s%> of <S%H6869>trouble<s%>: when he comes <S%H5927>up<s%> unto the <S%H5971>people<s%>, he will invade them with his <S%H1464>troops<s%>.

Although the fig <S%H8384>tree<s%> shall not <S%H6524>blossom<s%>, neither shall <S%H2981>fruit<s%> be in the <S%H1612>vines<s%>; the <S%H4639>labor<s%> of the <S%H2132>olive<s%> shall <S%H3584>fail<s%>, and the <S%H7709>fields<s%> shall <S%H6213>yield<s%> no <S%H400>food<s%>; the <S%H6629>flock<s%> shall be cut <S%H1504>off<s%> from the <S%H4356>fold<s%>, and there shall be no <S%H1241>herd<s%> in the <S%H7517>stalls<s%>:
Yet I will <S%H5937>rejoice<s%> in the <S%H3068>Lord<s%>, I will <S%H1523>joy<s%> in the <S%H430>God<s%> of my <S%H3468>salvation<s%>.

The <S%H3069>Lord<s%> <S%H136>God<s%> is my <S%H2428>strength<s%>, and he will <S%H7760>make<s%> my <S%H7272>feet<s%> like <S%H355>hinds<s%>' <S%H1869>feet<s%>, and he will make me to walk upon my high <S%H1116>places<s%>. To the chief <S%H5329>singer<s%> on my stringed <S%H5058>instruments<s%>.
